intro: Brachyachne fulva, commonly known as yellow bristlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats. The plant has slender, erect stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear yellowish to golden flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Brachyachne fulva is often found in association with other wetland plants, playing a role in maintaining ecological balance in these environments.
